newsitem.title: UK: Gehe's AAH to sell three Lloyds businesses.
newsitem.headline: Gehe's AAH to sell three Lloyds businesses.

text.p: AAH, the British arm of German pharmaceutical wholesaler Gehe AG, said on Tuesday that it intended to sell three businesses belonging to Lloyds Chemists Plc, which it acquired earlier this year.
The businesses include the Holland and Barrett health food chain, National Veterinary Supplies and Martindales, a specialist pharmaceutical manufacturer.
In a statement, AAH said "the sale of these three highly successful stand-alone businesses will allow AAH to concentrate fully on its core activities."
AAH, which became UK market leader in retail and wholesale pharmaceuticals following the Lloyds acquisition, said it would not comment on the identity of potential purchasers.

Holland and Barrett is Britain's biggest health food retailer, with 400 stores. Martindales Pharmaceuticals makes drugs to order for doctors, hospitals, pharmacies and clinics, while National Veterinary Services sells drugs and instruments for animal health.
